oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Biff Collie - 1974-09-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Jimmy C. Newman (performer), Clyde Moody (performer/songwriter), Bill Carlisle (performer), and Jimmy Riddle (performer), conducted by Biff Collie on September 12, 1974.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie asks Jimmy C. Newman about quitting the Grand Ole Opry -- Jimmy C. Newman talks about traveling -- Newman talks about the town he was born and raised -- Newman talks about going to conventions -- Newman talks about what got him into playing country music -- Newman talks about his ambitions -- Newman talks about the saying ""with a bullet"" in terms to record sales -- Collie concludes the interview -- Clyde Moody talks about his lyrical content being conservative -- Moody talks about the lyrical content of country music -- Moody talks about how country music has evolved since he started -- Moody thanks Collie for the work he does -- Moody talks about his early life and leaving his family at a young age -- Moody talks about his first job making money as a performer -- Moody talks about writing Six White Horses -- Moody talks about playing with Bill Monroe -- Moody talks about conventions and what he's contributed to country music (incomplete) -- Collie introduces Bill Carlisle -- Bill Carlisle talks about being born in Kentucky and being one of the Carlisle Brothers -- Carlisle talks about how Cliff and himself started out playing in Louisville, Kentucky -- Carlisle talks about being discovered unexpectedly by Columbia Records -- Carlisle talks about the lyrical content of modern music and that it should not have to use profanity -- Carlisle talks about performing with Stringbean -- Carlisle talks about Stringbean's attitude -- Collie tells a story about Stringbean and concludes the interview -- Jimmy Riddle talks about working on Hee Haw -- Riddle talks about being born in Dyersburg, Tennessee -- Riddle talks about the first time he made money performing music -- Riddle talks about Borrah Minevitch influencing him to play the harmonica -- [Unidentified harmonica tune] (Jimmy Riddle) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Newman, Jimmy C.; Moody, Clyde, 1915-1989; Carlisle, Bill; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982;
